description: Lists the accounts in an organization that are contained by the specified target root or organizational unit (OU). If you specify the root, you get a list of all the accounts that aren't in any OU. If you specify an OU, you get a list of all the accounts in only that OU and not in any child OUs. To get a list of all accounts in the organization, use the  ListAccounts operation. This operation can be called only from the organization's management account or by a member account that is a delegated administrator.

parameters.name: ParentId
parameters.description: The unique identifier (ID) for the parent root or organization unit (OU) whose accounts you want to list.

nested_items.name: Accounts
nested_items.description: A list of the accounts in the specified root or OU.

nested_items.name: Id
nested_items.description: The unique identifier (ID) of the account.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the account.

nested_items.name: Email
nested_items.description: The email address associated with the Amazon Web Services account.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The friendly name of the account.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The status of the account in the organization.

nested_items.name: JoinedMethod
nested_items.description: The method by which the account joined the organization.

nested_items.name: JoinedTimestamp
nested_items.description: The date the account became a part of the organization.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: If present, indicates that more output is available than is included in the current response. Use this value in the NextToken request parameter in a subsequent call to the operation to get the next part of the output. You should repeat this until the NextToken response element comes back as null.
